Class Observation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Observation

  • public final class Observation
extends Object
    Returned by Creature.look() and Creature.observeSelf().

      Point that was observed.

      Creature.UNINITIALIZED_CLASS_ID if this is not a shrine, or the classID for the creature owning the shrine

      Type of object at this location.

    • Field Detail

      • type

        public Type type
        Type of object at this location.

      • className

        public String className
        If type == Type.CREATURE, this is the class name of that creature. Otherwise, null. This is provided only for debugging. It is null unless security is disabled on the simulator to prevent creatures from colluding to throw matches.

      • classId

        public int classId
        Class ID (versus object ID) for the kind of object observed. The constants for this are defined in Creature. This can be used to distinguish creature types, since each creature class is assigned a unique ID at the beginning of the trial. For example, you could use this to react differently to FlyTraps, Apples, and unknown adversary creatures.
        See Also:
        Creature.isEnemy(Observation), Creature.getClassId()

      • id

        public int id
        If type == Type.CREATURE, this is the ID of that creature. Otherwise, 0.

      • direction

        public Direction direction
        If type == Type.CREATURE, this is the direction that creature is facing, otherwise, null.

      • position

        public Point position
        Point that was observed.

      • time

        public long time
        Value returned from Creature.getGameTime() when this observation was made.

      • inFog

        public boolean inFog
        Fog is an experimental feature and will never appear in a tournament map in 2012.

      • inMud

        public boolean inMud

      • shrineClassId

        public int shrineClassId
        Creature.UNINITIALIZED_CLASS_ID if this is not a shrine, or the classID for the creature owning the shrine
